meta_description: Macculloch Hall Historical Museum preserves the history of the Macculloch-Miller families through its historic site, collections, exhibits, and programs.

###  Visitor Information

__

#### Hours

  * Open Hours: 
    * Saturday and Sunday, 12:00-4:00 pm
    * Visit weekdays by appointment only
  * Gardens: Daily, 8:00 am-dusk. FREE. 
    * _**We do not host events or ceremonies in our gardens.**_
    * Staged photoshoots and professional photography are allowed in the gardens by permit only. Each session has a fee of $75.
  * Office: Monday-Friday, 9:00 am-5:00 pm.

To schedule an appointment or request a photography permit, contact 973-538-2404, ext. 101 or [email](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101091009/mailto:info@maccullochhall.org).

**Please note the following annual museum closures:**

  * Weekends in January, open weekdays by appointment only
  * Easter, April 20, 2025
  * Memorial Day Weekend, May 24-25, 2025
  * Fourth of July, July 4, 2025
  * Last two weekends in August, open weekdays by appointment only
  * Labor Day Weekend, August 30-31, 2025
  * Thanksgiving, November 27-30, 2025
  * Christmas, December 24-26, 2025

accessibility_text:
## Accessibility & Sensory-Friendly Experiences

Macculloch Hall Historical Museum welcomes all visitors to its historic house and garden. We are working to make the museum accessible for everyone, however, at this time full tours of the garden require uneven outdoor surfaces.

For additional information, please contact us by phone, 973.538.2404 or [info@maccullochhall.org.](http://web.archive.org/web/20260101091145/mailto:info@maccullochhall.org)

**Learn About:**

Physical Accessibility

At Your Own Pace: A Sensory-Friendly Tour

Bloomberg Connects

Bring Your Own Accessible Device Guide

Please Touch Tour

### Physical Accessibility

**Visitors with Limited Mobility**

The first floor of the house and Schoolroom Gallery are wheelchair accessible. Wheelchair entry into the house is via a ramp from the driveway into the Schoolroom Gallery.

The full tour of Macculloch Hall Historical Museum takes about 45 minutes and requires brief periods of movement and standing. Visitors in wheelchairs can tour the first floor of the house. Moving through the rooms may be difficult depending on the size of the wheelchair.

Macculloch Hall Historical Museum does not have an elevator, nor is it equipped with lifts.

At this time, Macculloch Hall Historical Museum does not have an accessible bathroom.

* * *

**Garden Access  
**  
The garden is accessible through the driveway gate. The walk up the gentle grade of the driveway is over a hard packed gravel surface. The garden contains a varie...
collections_text:
### Experience everyday American history where it happened.

#  Welcome to Macculloch Hall Historical Museum

Morristown's Community Museum

### Macculloch Hall Historical Museum

Newly arrived British immigrants George and Louisa Macculloch built Macculloch Hall in 1810. They expanded their Federal-style mansion in 1812 and 1819, tripling its size, as their family's prominence in local, state, and national affairs grew. Come explore the largest collection of original work of political cartoonist Thomas Nast (1840-1902), art, and American history where it happened.

[ ABOUT US ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260114223020/https://maccullochhall.org/about-us/ "Click Here")

### MUSEUM EXPERIENCES

#### Free Digital Guide

Available 24/7 from anywhere on Bloomberg Connects! Click the button below to learn more.

[ Free Digital Guide Information ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260114223020/https://maccullochhall.org/contact/digital-guide/ "Click Here")

#### Please Touch Tour

The _Please Touch Tour_ allows visitors to interpret the historic site and its collections through touch.

[ Please Touch Tour Information ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260114223020/https://maccullochhall.org/contact/accessibility/#touch "Click Here")

#### Bring Your Own Device Tour

Available on your computer, smartphone, tablet, or other smart device anywhere, anytime!

[ Take the Tour ](http://web.archive.org/web/20260114223020/https://maccullochhall.org/byod/ "Click Here")
